result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan C Whiteside

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan C Whiteside not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Juan C Whiteside.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense requested an adjournment to allow time to review Discovery and with Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan C Whiteside appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Juan C Whiteside.  Attorney Ian Vance-Curzan in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #08CF4687. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Emanuelson.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Received and Filed.
Attorney Michael Plaisted .

Defendant Juan C Whiteside not in court. Attorney Thomas Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Attorney Erin Karshen appeared on behalf of Attorney Chad Wozniak  for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for State V. Lee hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Thomas Reed advised the court, the Public Defender's Office has confirmed Attorney Michael Plaisted  has accepted appointment. Attorney Michael Plaisted was in Court, and confirmed. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch 45. Preliminary hearing is scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held in room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Juan C Whiteside not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with A.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  24/7 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment, medical and legal appointments.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Juan C Whiteside appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Juan C Whiteside.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K WARRANT
